## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 103, 640, 560]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space, \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space, \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space, \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge, \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant, \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass constant, \(u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron, \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton, \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant, \(R = 8.31 \mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant, \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant, \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant, \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall, \(g = 9.81 \mathrm{ms}^{- 2}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 107, 560, 144]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 163, 524, 180]]<|/det|>
\[W = \rho \Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 193, 536, 223]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 234, 524, 252]]<|/det|>
\[p = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 262, 572, 295]]<|/det|>
\[p = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V} < c^2 >\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 304, 536, 321]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 338, 608, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_{0}\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(\chi_{0}^{2} - \chi^{2})}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 384, 536, 418]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 426, 625, 445]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_{1} + 1 / C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 459, 593, 477]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_{1} + C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 490, 528, 514]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 526, 593, 545]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 560, 625, 579]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 593, 561, 611]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 628, 581, 646]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 655, 536, 688]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 604, 137]]<|/det|>
Energy is stored in a metal wire that is extended elastically.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 149, 146, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 149, 537, 168]]<|/det|>
Explain what is meant by _extended elastically_.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 183, 873, 203]]<|/det|>
<form>................................................................................................................

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 241, 148, 260]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 240, 680, 260]]<|/det|>
Show that the SI units of energy per unit volume are \(\mathsf{kg} \mathsf{m}^{-1} \mathsf{s}^{-2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 384, 876, 402]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 413, 144, 432]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 413, 803, 432]]<|/det|>
For a wire extended elastically, the elastic energy per unit volume \(X\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 443, 520, 462]]<|/det|>
\[X = C\epsilon^2 E\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 475, 344, 492]]<|/det|>
where \(C\) is a constant,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 490, 420, 508]]<|/det|>
\(\epsilon\) is the strain of the wire,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 507, 180, 524]]<|/det|>
and

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 505, 502, 524]]<|/det|>
\(E\) is the Young modulus of the wire.
